requirements.description: Company must ensure compliance with GDPR, COPPA, and other data protection laws when handling personal data of children under 16 years old.

type.summary: Compliance with child data protection laws

requirements.description: Company must not use Nuance's services for online sites, services, or products that are primarily directed at children under 16 years old.

type.summary: Prohibition on using Nuance services for primarily child-directed content

requirements.description: If Company uses Nuance software for child-directed sites, it must not send any child data to Nuance.

type.summary: No transfer of child data to Nuance for child-directed services

requirements.description: For mixed or general audience sites that may be accessed by children under 16, Company must have a verifiable parental consent mechanism and provide adequate notice regarding the transfer of child data to Nuance and Nuance's collection and processing of such data.

type.summary: Parental consent and notice requirements for non-child-directed services

requirements.description: Nuance is not considered an operator under COPPA.
